intro: Dianthus quadrilobus, commonly known as the four-lobed campion, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, characterized by its showy, pink or red flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has four-lobed petals, giving it its scientific name, and it typically grows in rocky or sandy soils. It is an annual or biennial herb with a low-growing habit, often forming dense mats. The leaves are linear and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its drought-resistant nature.
